title: Could Brian Thomas Jr. be a legitimate trade target for Patriots this offseason?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Brian Thomas Jr. recorded over 1,200 receiving yards in his rookie season with the Jacksonville Jaguars.
Potential Patriots target, Thomas, regressed with 707 yards in 2025 amid Jacksonville's offensive shifts.
The Patriots may trade for Thomas as a dynamic weapon to support QB Drake Maye's development.

title: 3 takeaways from Team USA men’s hockey’s OT win over Sweden in Olympics
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Quinn Hughes scored the overtime winner as Team USA defeated Sweden 2-1 in the 2026 Winter Olympics quarterfinals.
Dylan Larkin also scored for Team USA, while Mika Zibanejad's late goal tied it for Sweden in regulation.
Team USA advances to face Slovakia in the semifinals, with puck drop scheduled for Friday at 3:10 p.m. EST.

title: Pittsfield armored vehicle company is largest ICE contract in Mass.
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Lenco Industries in Pittsfield has secured $5.2 million in ICE contracts for BearCat armored vehicles.
The Massachusetts-based company received state grants to increase production despite growing scrutiny of ICE collaborations.
Governor Maura Healey expressed concern over state resources indirectly supporting ICE through local contracts.

title: Former State Police union head, lobbyist get more prison time for fraud, racketeering
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Former State Police union president Dana Pullman received an additional 2-year prison sentence for fraud and racketeering.
Lobbyist Anne Lynch was sentenced to an extra 15 months in prison for her involvement in the racketeering scheme.
Pullman and Lynch were charged with wire fraud, tax evasion, and obstruction of justice, causing financial damage to the union.

title: Boston 25 News head meteorologist Kevin Lemanowicz departing after 3 decades with the station
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Kevin Lemanowicz is leaving his position as chief meteorologist at Boston 25 News after nearly 30 years.
Lemanowicz will officially step down on February 27, 2026, according to an announcement from the station.
He has covered significant weather events, including the 2011 tornadoes, 2015 snowstorms, and 2023 Leominster flooding.

title: Red Sox release statement after outcry over flawed jersey design
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Red Sox will have updated home jerseys ready for Opening Day following design complaints about lettering overlap.
The team clarified that the jersey design flaws were their responsibility, not Fanatics', and adjustments are underway.
The revised Red Sox statement emphasized cooperation with MLB and Fanatics to correct the jersey design issues.

title: Pawtucket police find firearms in ice rink shooter’s storage locker, identify ‘courageous citizens’ who intervened
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Pawtucket police found firearms and ammunition in Robert Dorgan's storage unit related to a fatal ice rink shooting.
The suspect, Robert Dorgan, killed his ex-wife and son in a targeted attack at Dennis M. Lynch Arena.
Bystanders Michael Black, Robert Rattenni, and Ryan Cordeiro subdued the shooter; others rendered aid to victims.

title: MBTA announces service changes and suspensions for March
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: MBTA will suspend Orange Line and four Commuter Rail lines on weekends in March for signal upgrades.
Orange Line service from Back Bay to Forest Hills will halt Feb. 28 to March 8; shuttles provided.
Commuter Rail from North Station affected, with shuttles and extra travel time advised for four lines.

title: Rafael Devers reacts to Red Sox exec’s ‘pick up a glove’ comment
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Rafael Devers was traded from the Red Sox to the Giants in June 2025 amid positional disputes.
Red Sox chairman Tom Werner criticized Devers for refusing to play first base after an injury to Triston Casas.
Devers responded to Werner's comments by stating he wants to leave the past behind and focus on his future with the Giants.

title: Adam Schefter maps out potential price for Patriots in Maxx Crosby trade
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots are interested in acquiring Pro-Bowl pass rusher Maxx Crosby from the Raiders this offseason.
Adam Schefter noted that any Crosby trade would require a package similar to what the Cowboys received for Micah Parsons.
Maxx Crosby's relationship with the Raiders is strained, potentially leading to a trade despite the team's reluctance.
